mads:mads.mads:note: His Carmina [CF] 1991: PHI CD ROM #5.3, Latin Canon, bibliographic screen (Sueius)
Oxford class. dict., 1st ed.: p. 865 (Sueius; a pedantic writer of moral idylls. Some authorities attempt to identify him as Seius, a friend of Cicero and Varro)

Pauly-Wissowa: 2. Reihe, 7. Halbbd., col. 580-581 (Sueius; Roman poet; the name is often corrupted in the manuscripts though correctly cited in Müller Rh. Mus. XXIV 553; more would be known if identification could be made with M. Seius, but the spelling of the name prevents this)

The Fragmentary latin poets, 1993: p. 112-117 (Sueius; nothing is known of this bearer of the name; attempts to identify him with Seuius Nicanor or M. Seius, the friend of Cicero and Varro who kept flocks of birds at his villa, founder on the need to alter the form of the name, which clearly and consistently emerges from superficial corruptions in the sources; he is a contemporary of Cicero)
